page.title: 03THE STAPLETON ARMS
page.content: The public house in Buckhorn Weston is called the Stapleton Arms after the Stapleton family who owned the village some 300 years ago. They obtained it from the Stourtons(owners of Stourhead)in some form of marriage agreement.All the surrounding villages were retained by the Stourtons and later the Hoares. Sir Arthur Stapleton is the last remaining member of the Stapleton family and the estate has all been distributed.The pub is now a freehouse. It is regularly used by local people, about two dozen at any time during the evening. It has a dartboard and provides snacks.Beer is charged at approx.ninety pence a pint and spirits at around sixty to seventy pence for a single measure.
